cortex-debug.armToolchainPath.description: Path to the GCC Arm Toolchain (standard prefix is "arm-none-eabi" - can be set through the armToolchainPrefix setting) to use. If not set the tools must be on the system path. Do not include the executable file name in this path.

cortex-debug.armToolchainPrefix.description: The prefix to use for the arm toolchain - the standard release from arm uses "arm-none-eabi" but alternative toolchains may use a different prefix. Currently the gdb and objdump tools are needed.

cortex-debug.JLinkGDBServerPath.description: Path to the JLink GDB Server. If not set then JLinkGDBServer (JLinkGDBServerCL.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.openocdPath.description: Path to the OpenOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then openocd (openocd.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.pyocdPath.description: Path to the PyOCD GDB Server executable. If not set then pyocd-gdbserver must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.PEGDBServerPath.description: Path to the PEMicro GDB Server. If not set then PEGDBServer (pegdbserver_console.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.stutilPath.description: Path to the Texane's ST-Util GDB Server executable. If not set then st-util (st-util.exe on Windows) must be on the system path.

cortex-debug.enableTelemetry.description: Enable Telemetry for the Cortex-Debug Extension. Reporting will also respect the global telemetry.enableTelemetry setting.

servertype.description: GDB Server type - supported types are jlink, openocd, pyocd, pe and stutil

debuggerArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB command line

preAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main attach sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main attach sequence has finished.

preRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the beginning of the restart sequence (after interrupting execution).

postRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the restart sequence.

overrideAttachCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of attaching to a running target. In most cases it is preferable to use preAttachCommands and postAttachCommands to customize the GDB attach sequence.

overrideRestartCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of restarting the target. In most cases it is preferable to use preRestartCommands and postRestartCommands to customize the GDB restart sequence.

overrideGDBServerStartedRegex.description: You can supply a regular expression (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_Expressions) in the configuration property to override the output from the GDB server that is looked for to determine if the GDB server has started. Under most circumstances this will not be necessary - but could be needed as a result of a change in the output of a GDB server making it incompatible with cortex-debug. This property has no effect for bmp or external GDB server types.

cpu.description: CPU Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

machine.description: Machine Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

rtos.description: RTOS being used. For JLink this can be FreeRTOS, embOS or the path to a custom JLink RTOS Plugin library. For OpenOCD this can be eCos, ThreadX, FreeRTOS, ChibiOS, embKernel, mqx, or uCOS-III.

armToolchainPath.description: This setting can be used to override the armToolchainPath user setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the path where arm-none-eabi-gdb and arm-none-eabi-objdump are located.

toolchainPrefix.description: This setting can be used to override the toolchainPrefix user setting for a particular launch configuration.

gdbTarget.description: For externally controlled GDB servers you must specify the GDB target to connect to. This can either be a "hostname:port" combination or path to a serial port

annotate.description: Create annotations on the graph for when the target processor starts and stops execution. (green line for starting execution, red line for stopping execution).

plots.description: Plot configurations. Data sources must be configured for "graph" (or "advanced" with a decoder that sends graph data) in the "swoConfig" section

graphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the plot.

label.description: A label for this data set

timespan.description: Length of time (seconds) to be plotted on screen.
The amount of time (seconds) that the XY Plot will show the trace for.

xGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the X axis

yGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id Port for the Y axis

showDevDebugOutput.description: Prints all GDB responses to the console

svdFile.description: Path to an SVD file describing the peripherals of the microcontroller; if not supplied then one may be selected based upon the 'device' entered.

cpuFrequency.description: Target CPU frequency in Hz; 0 will attempt to automatically calculate.

source.description: Source for SWO data. Can either be "probe" to get directly from debug probe, or a serial port device to use a serial port external to the debug probe.

label.description: A label for the output window.

showOnStartup.description: If true, switches to this output when starting a debug session.

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

label.description: A label for the output window.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

swoFrequency.description: SWO frequency in Hz; 0 will attempt to automatically calculate.

ipAddress.description: IP Address for networked J-Link Adapter

serialNumber.description: J-Link Serial Number - only needed if multiple J-Links are connected to the computer

interface.description: Debug Interface type to use for connections (defaults to SWD) - Used for J-Link and BMP probes.

searchDir.description: OpenOCD dir to search for config files and scripts

v1.description: Set this to true if your debug probe is a ST-Link V1 (for example, the ST-Link on the STM32 VL Discovery is a V1 device). When set to false a ST-Link V2 device is used.

targetId.description: On BMP this is the ID number that should be passed to the attach command (defaults to 1); for PyOCD this is the target identifier (only needed for custom hardware)

boardId.description: PyOCD Board Identifier. Needed if multiple compatible boards are connected.

cmsisPack.description: Path to a CMSIS-Pack file. Use to add extra device support.

BMPGDBSerialPort.description: The serial port for the Black Magic Probe GDB server. On Windows this will be "COM<num>", on Linux this will be something similar to /dev/ttyACM0, on OS X something like /dev/cu.usbmodemE2C0C4C6 (do not use tty versions on OS X)

powerOverBMP.description: Power up the board over Black Magic Probe. "powerOverBMP" : "enable" or "powerOverBMP" : "disable". If not set it will use the last power state.

servertype.description: GDB Server type - supported types are jlink, openocd, pyocd, pe and stutil

debuggerArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB command line

preLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main launch sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main launch sequence has finished.

preRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the beginning of the restart sequence (after interrupting execution).

postRestartCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the restart sequence.

overrideLaunchCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of flashing and launching the target. In most cases it is preferable to use preLaunchCommands and postLaunchCommands to customize the GDB launch sequence.

overrideRestartCommands.description: You can use this to property to override the commands that are normally executed as part of restarting the target. In most cases it is preferable to use preRestartCommands and postRestartCommands to customize the GDB restart sequence.

overrideGDBServerStartedRegex.description: You can supply a regular expression (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular_Expressions) in the configuration property to override the output from the GDB server that is looked for to determine if the GDB server has started. Under most circumstances this will not be necessary - but could be needed as a result of a change in the output of a GDB server making it incompatible with cortex-debug. This property has no effect for bmp or external GDB server types.

cpu.description: CPU Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

machine.description: Machine Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

rtos.description: RTOS being used. For JLink this can be FreeRTOS, embOS or the path to a custom JLink RTOS Plugin library. For OpenOCD this can be eCos, ThreadX, FreeRTOS, ChibiOS, embKernel, mqx, or uCOS-III.

armToolchainPath.description: This setting can be used to override the armToolchainPath user setting for a particular launch configuration. This should be the path where arm-none-eabi-gdb and arm-none-eabi-objdump are located.

toolchainPrefix.description: This setting can be used to override the toolchainPrefix user setting for a particular launch configuration.

gdbTarget.description: For externally controlled GDB servers you must specify the GDB target to connect to. This can either be a "hostname:port" combination or path to a serial port

runToMain.description: If enabled the debugger will run until it the start of the main function.

annotate.description: Create annotations on the graph for when the target processor starts and stops execution. (green line for starting execution, red line for stopping execution).

plots.description: Plot configurations. Data sources must be configured for "graph" (or "advanced" with a decoder that sends graph data) in the "swoConfig" section

graphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the plot.

label.description: A label for this data set

timespan.description: Length of time (seconds) to be plotted on screen.
The amount of time (seconds) that the XY Plot will show the trace for.

xGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the X axis

yGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id Port for the Y axis

showDevDebugOutput.description: Prints all GDB responses to the console

svdFile.description: Path to an SVD file describing the peripherals of the microcontroller; if not supplied then one may be selected based upon the 'device' entered.

source.description: Source for SWO data. Can either be "probe" to get directly from debug probe, or a serial port device to use a serial port external to the debug probe.

label.description: A label for the output window.

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

label.description: A label for the output window.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value from the ITM port by the specified value. Can be used, for example, to scale a raw n-bit ADC reading to a voltage value. (e.g to scale a 12-bit ADC reading to a 3.3v scale you would need a scale value of 3.3/4096 = 0.0008056640625

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

ipAddress.description: IP Address for networked J-Link Adapter

serialNumber.description: J-Link Serial Number - only needed if multiple J-Links are connected to the computer

interface.description: Debug Interface type to use for connections (defaults to SWD) - Used for J-Link and BMP probes.

jlinkscript.description: J-Link script file - optional input file for customizing J-Link actions.

searchDir.description: OpenOCD dir to search for config files and scripts

v1.description: Set this to true if your debug probe is a ST-Link V1 (for example, the ST-Link on the STM32 VL Discovery is a V1 device). When set to false a ST-Link V2 device is used.

targetId.description: On BMP this is the ID number that should be passed to the attach command (defaults to 1); for PyOCD this is the target identifier (only needed for custom hardware)

boardId.description: PyOCD Board Identifier. Needed if multiple compatible boards are connected.

cmsisPack.description: Path to a CMSIS-Pack file. Use to add extra device support.

BMPGDBSerialPort.description: The serial port for the Black Magic Probe GDB server. On Windows this will be "COM<num>", on Linux this will be something similar to /dev/ttyACM0, on OS X something like /dev/cu.usbmodemE2C0C4C6 (do not use tty versions on OS X)

powerOverBMP.description: Power up the board over Black Magic Probe. "powerOverBMP" : "enable" or "powerOverBMP" : "disable". If not set it will use the last power state.

description: ARM Cortex-M GDB Debugger support for VSCode
name: cortex-debug
